review: We had such an incredible experience tonight! We came with our family for my husband's birthday, and the staff made it incredible! Bryant was on top of everything making sure we had everything we need, he had great suggestions, and he made sure we had a good time! The food was awesome, the drinks were marvelous, and we will definitely be returning! The manager was also incredibly accommodating! We are glad we chose to eat here tonight!

We ordered the Margherita, California Veggie and Five Cheese, with the latter two being the only ones I would recommend. The pizzas themselves were pretty good, they only come in one size that is enough for about 3 people. I also got the Mango Strawberry cooler which was refreshing and pretty to look at. This place is good for larger parties so that's why we picked it as our pizza destination...but with that being said the service sucks. I don't understand establishments that pride themselves on being good for big groups but then hire wait staff that resent any party above 4.

Great place for lunch or dinner! I have been here couple times and I had only wonderful experience. The food is delicious! My favorites are dumplings, avocado egg rolls, pizza and Chinese chicken salad. Everything was freshly cooked. Manager came few times to see if we were doing great. And yes we were! I definitely recommend this place. It is definitely 5

3.5 stars. This location is pretty nice. I like the wall to ceiling Windows, very bright, clean, modern atmosphere. The outside can be deceiving.  I've been to many other CPKs before and just never fell in love with their pizzas. Not sure what it is. I'm more of the whole in the wall, mom/pop store type of person when it comes to pizzas.  On the two occasions I've been to this one, the pizzas were alittle soggy. I've had the works, it was alright, a lot more veggies than I expected. And my friend introduced me to the spicy chicken chipotle. Wasn't bad either. I like the white sauce that comes with it.  What I haven't tried yet were their non pizza items, maybe I'll give them another try in the fututre. I saw some pretty good lunch deals on their website. Service has always been quick and friendly. Will come back.

It took one hour to get our food and there were only 5 at our table. There were four small tables of people at the restaurant so it was not busy. There seemed to be plenty of employees in the building, probably about the same number as there were customers. It took another 30 min to get our bill! Crazy! Then there's the food. It was not very good!

Pros: I have always absolutely adored CPK's pasta sauce. My family's vegan so pasta is always an easy option to find when we are traveling. The pasta sauce tastes very fresh, the humus platter is delicious, and the cauliflower bites are very spicy and pleasant. Cons: No matter which location we've went to CPKs are always very cold. They have an open kitchen and no separate systems or if they do they sure don't use them. At the most recent one it felt like no difference when we stepped outside (which was 57 degrees) Overall I love CPK but wish they would do something about the temperature.

I wanted to try this place out because of the hype I heard. They have good services for the first timers. They offered us a complementary white corn guacamole - it was good but nothing special. We ordered a California Veggie and a Roasted Artichoke pizza (mouth watering names right ? ). We had to wait a little longer than expected for the pizza to arrive - but I can wait surprisingly long time for amazing food. This one was surely NOT worth my wait. Nothing special about the pizzas or the crust. I would not go there again.

California Pizza Kitchen can either be really good, or very mediocre so read as 3.5 stars since it's not always consistent. I can't remember the last time I went to one, but I know it was at least 2 years ago. We were running errands in the area when our stomachs both growled yesterday, so we caved and figured why not?  It appears as though they may be trying to revamp the menu a bit. They were advertising new mojitos sweetened with agave and fresh mint that sounded yummy. They still have a lengthy list of wines as well which always pair nicely with Italian fare.  My husband ordered a beer and we started with their white bean hummus. It's served with your choice of traditional or whole wheat pita bread which they brought us piping hot out of the pizza oven. It was delicious! The only thing I didn't care for were the chunks of tomatos on top. Roasted red peppers I would understand but the combo of hummus and tomatoes didn't make sense to me.  They bring out complimentary bread and oil to the table also with herbs mixed in like rosemary, parsley, and red chili flakes for a subtle kick of heat. The bread was a tad crunchy for me because of recent dental work, but I hollowed out a slice and took the soft center to dunk which I enjoyed.  You have to get pizza at a pizza kitchen yes? So we shared the pepperoni because my husband wanted something with meat. My favorite is their white pie personally, but pepperoni is a classic so I couldn't argue. They have a roasted chicken and garlic pizza right now as well, but I'm weird about chicken and would lose my appetite if even the slightest piece of gristle made it to my plate so we didn't risk it. (this is why I stopped eating chicken at chipotle years ago too).  The pizza was good this time, albeit very oily from the pepperoni. Bonus points to our server though who refilled our waters at lightening speed and brought us things like extra napkins without having to ask.  While it's not the greatest pizza in the world, it will do in a pinch. I'm sure we will be back again, even if it is in another two years.

We just ordered a Thin crusted BBQ pizza and California Cobb salad that was delivered to our house. Thank goodness we got the salad because the pizza was so chewy, it literally took a couple minutes to get one bite down. My husband gave up. I love CPK, so I was extremely disappointed.

I had the fish tacos. I remember this used to taste really good. Now it's ok. Would I order this again, probably not. My kids had the original BBQ chicken pizza. That was good as usual. Hubby order spicy chipotle chicken pizza. This was pretty good. It taste like chipotle but on a pizza. ( FYI... I love chipotle). As for the appetizer "Crispy Mac & Cheese". This was pretty good. The kids loved it. Come in a plate of 4 round pieces.

Great fan of CPK. Whenever i get chance and i am Close to, i hit it all lol. This is one of my fav CPK, the way they cooked the way i asked. Nice staff, always on their toes to help you out and service, great service, great food They were busy lol Great job CPK Thanks

Love California Pizza Kitchen! One of the original fresh Pizza restaurants in town. Sure authentic Italian pizza is available in the area but at California Pizza Kitchen you get a yummy pizza with a crispy crust for less than$11.  Order the California Club Pizza; you will not be sorry. At first I thought lettuce on top with avocado and the mix of bacon and chicken is a nice flavor mix. If you are planning on taking some of the pizza home them ask them to put the lettuce be avocados on the side. They will give you extra to take home with you.  The ambiance is nice and clean and has a zen like feel; so California. If you have not visited California Pizza Kitchen in awhile then give them another try. They are now one of my top 5 restaurants to eat at.

The service here was less than stellar. The server seemed annoyed and agitated with us all night. We came to eat with a group and requested separate checks (when we sat down to make sure they were aware). The server misinterpreted and split the bill evenly. When we requested that they correct it, we were told it would take 30 minutes. And the server had the nerve to argue with us and make snide comments about us "changing our minds." Incredibly disappointing experience.

They have pretty good pizza here. I enjoy their thin crust pizza. I have come here on multiple occasions and the service is not great at all. One serve was very rude to me and the pizza came out kind of cold. I would not say it is worth the price
Lupe our waitress ran off halfway through our order. I wasn't able to order any food no matter how many times I tried to stop her.

Food was ok, service was great but that guy who sat us totally creeped us out. Reminded me of Lurch from the Adams Family. Thank God we didn't have to deal with him anymore. He was a buzz kill for sure! Our server was great!

We ate at the CPK in Grapevine today. Food was good, but service not so good. Waitress only did the minimum. Pasta was served with very little grated cheese, we had to ask for more cheese. Also we had to ask for our water glasses to be refilled. Waitress looked annoyed when I asked. Restaurant was not very busy so no excuse for poor service.

I am not a fancy pizza place kinda person but they do have a lot of variety.. I had the california club which is basically a an arula avacado tomatoes salad on top of a chicken pizza.  I prefer hand toss over thin crust.  The pizza itself is bland and they did not have siracha or hot sauce.  We shared a red velvet cake which is really good.  It has a thin layer of vanilla bean. Surprisingly it was not overly sweet or that rich.  I may just stick with the Original bbq chicken pizza since that is what they are known for... Or red velvet cheesecake.. My favorite is red velvet cheesecake from Cheesecake Factory.

Last week we took a group of seven people here for a late lunch (1:00 pm) to celebrate a co-workers birthday.  It had been a long time since I had been to this location so I did not remember what to expect.  Our waiter was Alberto and he did a great job taking care of the group, luckily there were not a lot of tables still left from the lunch crowd. I arrived later than the rest of the group because of meeting that had already been scheduled, so when I arrived with one additional person in the party they got us caught up with the rest of the group right away.  Alberto brought the two of us a fresh plate of bread and olive oil and go our order in right away. I had the Thai chicken pizza which was very tasty.  The thin crust is very light and has a great crunch or snap to it.  The flavors are full and spicy which makes this relatively simple pizza a real winner. Everyone in our party seemed very pleased with their choice of food and we had a great time. Enjoy.

Just had my second ever DoorDash delivery, swore I never would again but I love California pizza kitchen..the first time they messed up the order badly and took 90 minutes. This time the food was correct but colder than my fridge. If I had wanted to heat up my own food , I would have . Please, please - California Pizza Kitchen, get a delivery service that allows your fans to still get the food delivered as you would serve it....? I would not want them to represent my business if I were you (Grapevine)

CPK use to be my family's favorite spot to eat, but over the years it has faded into a distant memory because of their declining performance. Despite our disappointment with them, we decided to give them another shot because we were feeling nostalgic. We decided to order two pizzas from there hoping that with their renovations came revitalized dishes.  We ordered the california veggie pizza and the thai chicken pizza online and were given an estimated ready time. I arrived a few minutes early and parked in the designated pick-up parking spot as instructed. I'm pretty patient so I waited until 10 minutes after the estimated ready time before getting anxious. I texted my mom and asked her if I was supposed to go inside. She assured me that I was just supposed to wait in the parking spot. I waited another five minutes and then another car pulled up next to me. I decided I would watch them and see if they went inside. They didn't; so the wait continued. Finally after another 10 minutes, a worker came outside, but he only went to the other man's car. He didn't even stop by my car. This really made me angry. Then after disappearing for another five minutes, he came out with the other guy's pizza and a receipt for me to sign. He went inside right after and I continued to wait another 5 minutes for him to reappear. This time he thankfully had my pizza, which I presumed would be fresh out of the oven since they made me wait 35 minutes. When I got home (I live 2 minutes away) we were disappointed to find that the pizza was not even warm. We had to heat up our pizza in the toaster oven. As for the flavors, they were sub par. The thai chicken had a bit of a kick, but there was barely any chicken on it. The veggie pizza was decent, but once again nothing special. Definitely not worth the struggle with them.
Great place, I love their barbecue chicken pizza and the lemon tequila pasta. It's never too crowded and the service is excellent!
Go try the strawberry mojito before summer ends! The drink is quite pricey for a chain but incredibly delicious!  I've never had a bad meal at CPK and love their Asian chop salad!

After not trying their pizza in a very long time, I decided to give it another go. I tried their lunchtime special - single person pizza and a salad. The pizza was a bit cold and not that tasty, the salad was good, and the service was just OK....in other words, it's just an OK place. I do like their Arugula Salad (a regular menu item). I have never been a great fan of their pizza and this visit didn't change that. I will go back for that Arugula Salad, however.

Came here with the wife and baby on a rainy Sunday afternoon after church. The place was pretty empty so we were promptly seated. We got the spinach dip as an appetizer which came with tortilla chips. We usually love spinach dip as it is a ubiquitous appetizer that is hard to mess up. That being said we were pretty disappointed with the watery tasting dip. I got the Hawaiian pizza with bacon substituted for ham and my wife got the tequila lime chicken pasta. The pizza was nothing great, and the pineapples clearly came out of the can and were in huge slices on the pizza. My wife didn't enjoy her pasta, and it did seem dry without enough Alfredo sauce. The butter cake dessert with a scoop of ice cream was pretty good and our server was nice, but those were the only upsides of our meal.

A co-worker picked CPK for his birthday lunch last week, and upon walking in, I realized that it has probably been (literally) 20 years since I've been in the place. For better or worse, the interior, though clean, looks like it may not have changed much in that 20 years. I was almost getting a coffee shop/diner vibe from it (not that there's anything wrong with that).  Upon being seated, our server brought out some small bread pieces with a tiny dish of herb infused oil; it was good, but the oil dish needs to be about twice as big as it was.  Browsing the menu, I almost went with my standby from the '90s, Thai chicken pizza,. but I decided to go with the Jamaican jerk chicken pizza. Upon delivery, I was a bit surprised to find that it was cut into five (!) unequally sized pieces (I didn't try to do the math). It featured chicken, bacon, red and yellow bell pepper, green onion and possibly some other veggies. The sauce, although vaguely "jerk-y", almost seemed more like a sweet and sour. It was an OK taste, but I've had decently authentic jerk chicken, and this wasn't it. Most of the heat seemed to come from my self-applied crushed red pepper flake.  The crust was a tiny bit tough (and much more so when I ate the rest for dinner), bit was otherwise OK.  All in all, it was a decent meal, and the menu has enough variety to where everyone can find something to eat, but it wouldn't be my first choice for the best and/or most authentic pizza.

Wanted something yummy after church on Sunday, and this place was a great choice! Our waitress was very sweet and attentive. The manager was kind enough to welcome us for the first time with a complimentary starter plate. We ordered a five cheese & tomato and a California club on thin crust, and both of them were delicious! If you crave pizza and wish to have a fine dining experience, cpk in Grapevine would a good recommendation :) oh and don't forget to order that strawberry mango cooler!!

We went here for a graduation party for our niece.   The service was average.   Waiter looked like he was not interested in the job.  He took his own sweet time to bring us the mini plates for starters.   Didn't bother to clean up the table before the entres.  Waiter  who started our orders came and said in the middle that his shift is over and another waiter is taking over!!   I have never this happen before.   Waiter looked like a high school graduate.  Though none of us said anything - it was not a good service.  Restaurant was not even busy!!   I

For an older chain restaurant, this one remains quite good.  I've always liked their salad and pizza offerings.  They continually update their menu to keep up with the times. A recent return reinforced prior memories.  Only negative is that it is a bit pricey for some of the small, but tasty,  plates that we tried.

I'm from L.A. Cali. Where the best foods are from Texas.  Now I live in the great state of Texas and I run into California Pizza; What! Nice building +, good location+, good service+, food bad -, price high - Food is very bland and tasteless, I had the jambalaya, kids had pizzas.  Nothing was good, won't go back anytime soon.

Went for lunch a few days ago, when it was surprising not crowded at all! I had high hopes. Ten minutes after sitting down, my friend and I still had not been waited on. No drink order. Nothing. So we decided to go somewhere else. As we were leaving we told the hostess nobody had waited on us, and she just said, "I'm sorry," and continued talking to the teenage boy who opens the door. As in, that's his job-to open doors for customers. At lunch. When it's not crowded. Management issues perhaps? This place has gone way downhill.

I had the "spicy" chipotle chicken pizza. It was good but wasn't spicy enough for me. I had them bring some of the habanero salsa they use on the carnitas pizza. It helped but I question how much habanero is actually in that salsa.  Service was good. The pizza dough is good and overall was a good experience. If your not in mood for pizza but everyone else in your party is then they have a good selection of over things that all sounded very tasty.
Had a great meal and excellent service at the Grapevine TX location.  Shout out to Lupe and the young man who was the host.  Well done team

There used to be a time when CPK was a progressive and cool restaurant. Those days have passed, and now CPK is just meh. The food is still good but they have fallen stagnant and service has deteriorated.  It has been a while since we'd visited this location and the old pizza standbys are there and I was glad to see some options with the calorie count next to it. I ordered the shrimp zucchini fettuccine - it was good but the shrimp could have used some more seasoning. The sauce is a broth but I enjoyed the way the zucchini is incorporated into the dish.  The most surprising thing right off the bat is how empty the place is. I remember when there was a long wait for a table. The service was nothing spectacular and I didn't see anything that needed improvement cleanliness-wise.  I did notice that our server was not even in uniform. He was wearing jeans and a polo short. Wasn't there a time when they wore uniforms?  I decided that what has happened over the years is this: the public's tastes and restaurant menus have become more sophisticated and have simply outgrown CPK, who has not changed very much over time.

This was our first time at CPK and we were seated promptly. Our server Blake was awesome! He provided us with a couple small plates as first time guests and was very friendly and attentive and got us set up on the rewards program. We got the quesadillas and a flatbread as small plates and the Five cheese and tomato with bacon. Everything tasted great but what made the experience was how friendly the staff was.

Can't believe I haven't reviewed this one yet! I like CPK well enough. Back in the 90s when they first opened I loved them! They just seemed to become just blah as time went on. The pizzas are good with a wide variety. They have many salad choices and I like that they offer the "Two in a Bowl" soup. The two soups, tortilla and pea complement each other well. They also have an array of pastas, chicken dishes and sandwiches. A little bit of everything. I noticed they recently put a few new things on their menu that look very interesting. I like that they are staying with the new "get healthy trend" and put quinoa in one of their salads. I'm not sure I've seen quinoa in a mainstream restaurant to date. I tried their Asparagus and Arugula salad which was outstanding! We also tried the White Corn Guacamole & Chips which was also another great dish. Overall CPK is a good place to go for a variety of flavors and food.

Very good, had mushroom and spinach flatbread and California Cobb Salad.  Server took our drink order fast and the flatbread came out fairly quickly from there on things slowed way down. The salad took a very long time to get to the table.  Then it took awhile to get the check. But food was very good.

My first time eating at a California Pizza Kitchen.  The staff was super friendly.  The guacamole was delicious!  I ordered the chicken flat bread pizza, it was okay nothing special.  We also shared egg rolls which were freaking awesome! They have a point system like almost any business. The more you buy the more points you get and then you are able to redeem them for free food.

LMAO NO THANKS! Yo if i could give less than 1 star i would. First of all, the damn service took too damn long. The steak they brought was undercooked and we sent it back and it was like my grandma's personality. tough (she grew up in war-torn south korea). Ok anyway, the waiter was hella hot, thats why I gave it 1 star. Love y'all peace love life.

My family loves the food at CPK especially the split pea and ham soup.  But the disappointing thing for us is the service.  The simple act of clearing dirty dishes off the table once the guests are finished should be ALWAYS taught to every server.   Had to ask a couple of servers to clear the plates and even then they didn't bother to take ALL the dirty plates through desserts and paying bill.  Terrible that a big organization like CPK would not provide adequate training to those who interact with customers.

I don't like chain restaurants.  If I can stay away from them - I usually do.  The local mom and pop joints are usually the best.  But I have to say - I really like this location of CPK.  The service is consistent.  The food is great.  I'm in love with the Mac & Cheese.  It's a comfort food kind of place and I love it.  Drop in and check it out.  You'll be glad you did.

My favorite place to carbo-load! Love the food, we had great service. The location seemed a bit odd, and the construction all around them must be impacting their sales because it was pretty empty and we went on a Saturday night. But I will always love the food at CPK! We usually get the Chipotle Chicken Pizza -- has a great kick and wonderful flavor. I got the Chicken Tequila Fettucini which is a tangy flavorful pasta dish that is so unique and so good. They have a great wine selection too!
I ordered the California Cobb and it was fantastic! My waiter, Kaiden, was so nice and he should totally get a raise! Would totally recommend it

I must have visited this place often enough to have owned a small share of the company by now. I would easily be the Duke, King, Supreme commander of this CPK. My wife loves their Asparagus and Spinach spaghettini and has had it every single time we've been here ( or any other CPK). I've tried several of their menu items Mango-Tikka PIzza.. good.. no longer on the menu Japanese Eggplant, Goat cheese, roasted peppers pizza. This is awesome..again no longer on the menu... whyyyy? Pepperoni . OK. Boring after a while Margaritta, ditto Chicken Tequilla Fettucine... fantastic flavor Ive tried a bunch of their appetizers all of which were good. I just done understand who orders some of their pizzas though.. like the salad pizzas.. It has been relatively consistent for all our visits and never had to wait for a table. (for the number of times I've come here, they should have a table with my name on it by now). The Mrs finally said that she was bored of the spaghettini. Finally!!! however the bad news is that Hell has frozen over and its going to snow in Dallas in August
Happy to report my second time here was delicious and the service was great. First time was super super slow. I will be back.
Best CPK I've ever been to is this location. We have a food allergy concern and the manager and the staff were extremely attentive to our experience. They are very friendly and the food is great!

CPK just doesn't do it for me.  They have all sorts of varieties of pizza and while some of them are novel, i don't think any of them are great.  I feel like pizza probably isn't the healthiest food in the world and if I am going to eat pizza, I want to eat good flavorful pizza and for my taste buds, CPK isn't it. There salads are pretty decent though.

One of the best place that I had pizza in last 5 years. The atmosphere is nice the decor and the view is pleasant. We ordered the Jamaican Jerk Pizza along with Thai Pizza and lettuce wraps and appetizers. The lettuce wraps were phenomenal. It had the flavor and the perfect sauce to compliment it.  The jerk pizza with thin crust by far was the best pizza i ever had. The Thai Pizza was so yummy that the word cant describe it. Overall this place is the bomb. Come here and enjoy your pizza with the beer.

Was not impressed with CPK. The service was terrible. There was only 4 other tables occupied and it took forever for our waiter to bring us anything. And when it arrived it wasn't even what we ordered. The salads were good but we had to send back our pizza. For a pizza joint, this was ridiculous.
Alex our waiter was awesome and the food delicious!  Tostada pizza and California blt pizza, are my favorite!

One of my favorite meals on the planet is to share a Thai chicken pizza with my wife at California Pizza.   And now with the new crust, it is just incredible.  I only wish their side items and salads were less expensive ( or maybe came in smaller portions).  But I love this place!!   And now they have Coke products!

This would be my first time at a CPK. We came through on a Saturday afternoon. It wasn't too busy and we were greeted and sat right away. I ordered a Cranberry Cooler to drink and I wasn't impressed. He actually brought me a second one because I thought their club soda was out. Turns out the club soda was fine, this drink is just lacking so I suggest to pass on this one. Everyone ordered something different at our table. Hubbub ordered Chicken, spinach and artichoke pizza. My oldest daughter ordered chicken Thai pizza. I ordered The Greek but opted to do the vegetarian version which has avacoda instead of chicken. They were all DELICIOUS! The Greek tasted so fresh! There is also a guarantee at the bottom of every menu. They want you to be adventurous and try something NEW! If you don't like it they'll bring you usual pizza at no cost instead allowing you to try something different.  Then I ordered dessert to go. Red velvet cake with vanilla bean cream icing. It was all very good! The only reason I give it 4 stars if because it can be pretty expensive. I would give it 4 1/2 stars really. Service was pretty good.

The nicest part was the restaurant, bored staff, small portions, corporate microwaveable food. Did not like the chips with the dip appetizer, tasted like it came out of a plastic bag, that had been microwaved. Pizza was burnt.

If you like real pizza, go somewhere else!  This place is for soccer moms and dudes who wear tight jeans with rhinestones.  You can eat a full pizza and need to stop and get a burger on the way home.  Their pizzas have super thin crust with a tiny bit of ingredients and it is WAY over priced. I don't mind eating a pizza with half the ingredients, just charge me half!  There were quite a few MILFs in this place...that is about the best thing I can say.

One of worst cpk places I ever visited...place was almost empty and we were waiting to serve at least water  for 15 mins....nothing happened...there was American couple came after 15 mins their order was taken , water was served ad we were still not serve water ..never though CPK had racial intensions .....

The pizza is great! Lots of specialty pizzas and the BBQ chicken and Jamacian Jerk are delicious! Disappointed that they replaced their sourdough with a plain white bread. They have become quite  expensive and have narrowed down the menu but the pizza is delicious!

Yeah, yeah, yeah, it is a chain. Get over it. Chains aren't such a bad thing and pump out great stuff. See Whole Foods, for example. Like everyone else, I am picky about my pizza. I like mine thin crust so I can taste the toppings and am not stuck eating bread with a cheese and sauce after thought. I like it out of a wood burning oven with a crispy crust, almost burnt in places. I like the toppings to be fresh with herbs and variety. And California Pizza Kitchen pulled through on just that last night. My wifey and I split The Sicilian and it was amazing. Thing crust, spicy marinara, giant slices of pepperoni, sweet Italian sausage and other stuff that was off the charts good. My Mom had a margherita (spelling?) and I am currently eating it left over... not bad. Dad had a salad I need to learn to make at home, the Miso salad with crab and shrimp. It was light, sweet, filling and fancy for whatever $10 or so he paid for it. I'd go back just to get a full portion of that salad. The service was great. We had some girl from Omaha (her badge said so) and she was chipper and gleeful and all kinds of helpful. The only downside is you can tell she had to go through the corporate motions of upsell this, talk about that, mention the raspberry lemonade, blah blah blah. I waited tables, I see right through that. Don't sell to me, I can figure out you have a full bar and probably serve Coors Light. A note on the decor in this place: I don't remember it being bad, but then again the last time I went in was 5 years ago. It is combinations of yellow and khaki and it just seems dated. It is like a Pei Wei but the tacky old 70s version of it. But the pizza was great, so who cares.

Good, fresh and delicious as usual. I never leave heavy when I eat here. Manager is great and super nice. I give the food a 5, service 4 and menu selection 5 as it has salads, pizza and great appetizers.

Yes, California Pizza Kitchen has been around for a long time. The pizza is still good but I want to say how wonderful the service was on my last visit. I sat at the bar area and ordered a pizza to go. The manager himself came over and took my order and got it right. While I was waiting for the pizza two other servers came by and asked if I needed or wanted anything. As soon as the pizza came out of the oven, I received it right away. They were very friendly and eager to take care of me. Good service speaks volumns. I found the price to be very acceptable as well.
Wife and I come here once, maybe twice a month. Pizza is good. Pastas very good. Service tonight was excellent, has been uneven the past few visits.

Went inside to order to go and have a beer while waiting. Ordered the thin crust spinach and artichoke, Caesar salad and dessert. The salad was fresh and normal for a Caesar. The pizza however was horrible.The crust was so rubbery you couldn't even separate the pieces from each other. That's what happens when you pre-bake the crust ahead of time. No telling how long they had been there. I witnessed the cook moving all over the kitchen working on orders and not once did she put on gloves. When I let the waitress know this before I left , she told the manager who proceeded to go into the office. I would have been right on that if I was the manager. Will not go back!!

This was the first time we have been there in several years. Of course, we are expected the menu to be updated, but I was disappointed that it no longer included portobello mushroom ravioli. The drink menu was also updated. I decided to try the strawberry mojito to, which was good. I ordered the mushroom pizza and my husband ordered the pepperoni, sausage and mushroom pizza, both on a thin and crispy crust. Both were very good. These are the things that earned the 3 stars awarded. Now for the problems that cost them the other two stars: when I ordered the mojito, my husband ordered a beer. They brought me 2 mojitos and him no beer. After returning one of mojitos his beer arrived. While waiting for our pizza, the waitress asked if I'd like another mojito and I said, "yes." That mojito never arrived. When the pizzas arrived, my husband's was not thin and crispy, but he didn't complain. Shortly thereafter, a gentleman from the kitchen showed up to offer the thin and crispy pizza, which had apparently been sitting there all along. He switched pizzas. Finally, we asked for a to go box and we needed to remind the waitress to get that after we paid the bill.  For whatever reason, they did not appear to have their act together tonight.

This is your typical over hyped restaurant. I'm not sure why people love this place so much. Maybe it's because it makes them " feel special" for eating at an over hyped below average pizza place. I would gladly go with the cheaper and better pizza option somewhere else.

Do not use the delivery service. It is a third party delivery service,  . We ordered a pizza at 6:35pm, at 7:30 I called California Pizza. I was told they pizza had been boxed and was waiting on the delivery person to pick it up. Called again at 8pm as we less the 10 minutes away and was told the pizza had been picked up. The pizza was delivered at 8:35, stone cold. California Pizza has a good product but their delivery service is terrible. I contacted the manager and was told the service will make it right, the delivery service said the restaurant was responsible. Never again!

Too many other better pizza choices in the area makes this place come up short. California Pizza Kitchen really led the way with Gourmet pizza many years ago. They have tried to refresh their menu but it just doesn't cut it like it used to. I tried to mix it up with the new Habenero Carnitas pizza. It was good but Grimaldi's, across the street just blows this place away with a traditional, no gimmick pie. Also had the Asian Chicken Salad. Tasted like it was poured out of a pre-made pouch. Just was not like I remember it. Everything tasted good and service was friendly and efficient. Just lost my taste for this place. If in the area, Grimaldi's, Fireside Pies, Mellow Mushroom and Coal Vines are easily better choices.
The bartender was friendly with all his regulars  and paid not attention to anyone else. Not a good experience. I won't be back.

1 star is being nice.....but I had to leave a rating in order to review.  Very very disappointing.  The Asian chicken salad was served with soggy, translucent lettuce and little flavor.  We sent it back and the 2nd one had more flavor but the same lettuce.  ( they did remove it from the tab, though) The pizza was served at room temperature and the thin crust was a bit soggy. The wine was served after we had finished the salads and the pizza was delivered.  Our server noticed the wine glasses weren't satisfactorily cleaned and went to replace them causing another delay. We have eaten at many CPK's and have never before had this kind of experience.  We will not be returning.

this was my 2nd time here & it's always with my co-workers....I ordered the hawaiian bbq chicken pizza (thin crust)...even though i'm not a huge fans of onion slices on my pizza....this was actually pretty dayum good. we also had the spinach artichoke dip....it needed a little more flavor but for the most part it was decent.

This is one chain I can always count on to be consistent. They have the BEST salads. Not a big fan of their appetizers. I noticed yesterday that they now offer wheat pasta! However, what's the point with cream sauce?  I love their roasted eggplant and goat cheese pizza...it's my go-to everytime along with the BBQ chopped chicken salad or the Waldorf Chicken Salad.  The best way to enjoy CPK to me is to split a pizza and salad with a friend, that way you get both your favorites!

It has honestly been 7 or 8 years between visits to CPK. The last time I had been was for a friends birthday in high school. The food was good just on the high end. The husband is a picky pizza eater and never liked it, Plus it was always awkward to get in and out, add construction which made it worse. We got a free kids meal from a reading club so decided to give it an updated shot after a movie one wed afternoon just the kiddo and I.  The service was good, and we stuck to pizza because it was in the name. Yet I will admit I for what would be a "plain one topping pizza" it's on the pricy end. My daughter got a plain cheese and I did the smaller tomato and cheese. We ended up still spending about if not more after adding tip what we would have taking her somewhere a little more kid friendly. They do have a  cheep child desert option which was huge for my kiddo.  They did end up giving us back the coupon to come back again, so maybe we can get my husband to try it again if we're over there.
I went during lunch for the first time and I'm not a fan and I don't think I will be going back. The price of the ordinary food served is crazy.

Disappointing. Not well run. I had multiple wait staff, even the manager, and no one really owned my table nor gave me my credit card back. When I realized it was at the restaurant, the hostess was very inappropriate in not apologizing, only being silly and too happy. It's my card and no one cared enough to call me--despite one of my waiters tracking my name and number for my Dough card. Worst CPK experience in waitstaff; food was fine.Be forewarned: pay cash and go.
Not very clean, food ok, long wait time The only pizza kitchen I can compare this to was Poway, CA but it falls very short

We've been going to this CPK for a couple of years, and always had a nice experience.  Until the latest trip a couple of days ago. Mid afternoon.  Very light customer traffic.  Were greeted by the smiling and friendly seating host who quickly put us in our favorite booth.   Then nothing. Seriously - nothing.  At least three waiters walked past us a couple of times, not even acknowledging our existence.  Then the manager walked by us.  Twice.  We had suddenly become invisible.  Lots of visiting other tables by the waiters and the manager; lots of laughter at those tables.  Crickets at ours. I tried to get the attention of the waiters a couple of times.  No.  After nearly 15 minutes, I finally walked back to the seating host, who acted surprised that I was visible.  He seemed genuinely shocked at my presence - didn't remember us at all.   So the seating host walked up to one of the wait staff, who then began to argue with him about serving us.  What the hell?  So far as we could tell, we didn't stink and we could see each other, so why did all this happen? After much arguing, she came to our table and I tried to ask her about a discount coupon we had.  She took our drink order and said she'd take care of the discount.   Then more nothing.  No drinks, no bread, no nothing.   Just as I reached for my phone to leave, another waiter showed up.  He had just arrived and seemed to be able to see us.  At last!  We weren't invisible any more! He took care of everything in a friendly, but cautious manner.  Apparently he'd been told we were trolls and he had drawn the short straw to be our server.  But, honestly, he did his best.  There was one strange interaction when he asked us if we wanted fresh bread.  We said yes (of course).  Then no bread.  When we asked him about it, he said that the kitchen had decided not to bake any bread.   Finally, the manager came to our table to open our discount card.  But, despite appearing to be the same manager who was friendly and laughing with other customers, he was stone-faced and very unfriendly with us.   Strangest encounter with a restaurant in my life.  I've had worse encounters, but this one took the cake for weirdness.
CPK is amazing! i love their pizza, the atmosphere, and service. Get any of their salad pizzas, they are super good.

Decor: 3/5 -Typical CPK layout with tables and booths. The booths had tears in them though Service: 4/5 -Food was prepped and served pretty quickly. We were seated, served and billed in about 30 minutes. We're also an efficient couple :) Food: 3/5 -Avocado Egg Rolls were tasty and rich yet heavy. I was getting full after eating 3 pieces -BBQ Chicken tasted different than their other location but was good with crushed red peppers

I tried CPK for the first time inside the Willowbend Mall in Plano. The first bite of that pizza, whoa, it was great! This location is not any different; being a chain doesn't make it taste any less than a mom and pop homemade pizza shop.  My friend used to work at one of the CPK's and frequently brought food back for us to try so I am lucky to have tried most of the things on the menu. I really recommend the Tuscan Hummus as a appetizer as they bring warm pita bread to accompany the savory hummus. It's topped with fresh tomatoes and parsley and thick enough to melt on your palate. Yummy.  I always get the Chinese Chicken Salad with my meal because the napa cabbage is cut thinly and nice, and all the meals regardless of what you order have great chemistry together, and you leave satisfied and happy after each meal. Service is always great! You can also order the pizza to be thin crust or with honey crust. The California Club has huge slices of avocado waiting for your to devour it. For those who haven't tried CPK, you need to go!

Our food was so good, but the service was very slow even though there were only 4 other tables at the restaurant. They must be under staffed, but our waiter was still friendly and was sincerely sorry that service was slow.

I love California pizza kitchen! It's a nice change of pace from all of the other pizza joints in the area. They also have these little small tapas plates that are so yummy - I always get the greek plate that comes with whole wheat pita bread, hummus, a little greek salad and some feta. Delicious! Everything I've had is good here, and their service is excellent.

Went at lunch with several co-workers for salads. Sat right down and waiter came to take orders. He was nice but kitchen was very slow. When others were sat next to us and they received their orders of pizza and salads we asked about our orders. An apology by the waiter but after 15 more minutes no lunch. To make it all worse the manager on duty didn't even explain or apologize for the delay. I needed dressing for the salad and had to wait even longer for that and a part of the salad was missing. We had been warned by other co-workers to avoid eating there as it was extremely slow. They were right. Over an hour to get salads and wait while others received their food around us. Not going back even at night. Also, salad was not worth the wait or price.

The waiter took forever, I uploaded a photo of where all the waiters hung out behind the counter instead of helping customer because chatting was more portant than serving food.  Service was POOR. The food was good, but I didn't like the overly open atmosphere.

I really like CPK, but strangely enough, my favorite dish here is not the pizza. The pizza is great, it really is, but I LOVE the fusilli pasta with sun-dried tomatoes and broccoli. It is a nice, light meal without heavy sauces...just some olive oil - "Baby broccoli, garlic, sun-dried and fresh tomatoes, thyme and Parmesan. Also available with grilled chicken breast or goat cheese." It is definitely an excellent choice if you want something other than pizza.

I'm from California so I used to go to CPK all the time.. Moved to Texas and they don't have that many locations.. luckily I live 5 minutes from this one..  I picked up my friend at DFW Visiting from California and I ask where do you want to have dinner, He says CPK... WHAT?? you live in California DUDE... but it did sound good so We went..  Every time I go i get the Usual. Tostada Pizza or Chicken Tequila pasta. OOH so Yummy.  This time I Decided to try something different, had the Pesto Pizza it was delicious, My friend had the Chicken BBQ salad Also Delicious!!!  Service was GREAT, our waitress Guadalupe was so Cute.. I ordered a California Cosmo and She asks for my I.D ... aaah too cute, cant remember the last time i was carded.  The Pizza's are always Huge... think I'll go and have me some Leftovers right now...............

Now, I've always been a fan of the CPK frozen pizzas so I had to try this place. I went there yesterday after work and if you register with them on their website you can print off a $5.00 off your order of $20.00 or more, so that enhanced the "should I try it or not." Now we got there and order the dynamite shrimp..which if I remember correctly Applebees has something very similiar and in all honesty they taste exactly the same. Not bad, just un-original. So there pizza selection was amazing. Finally decided on the Club Pizza. Now I will hand it to them on this one. Never seen or tasted anything like it before. It had bacon and cheese, then on top of that was alot of lettuce rolled in a mayonaise sauce they make. Atop of that was huge slices of avacado. The pizza pretty much won me over. The size is not very big, but who wants to take that pizza home with lettuce and avacado and reheat it? So I saw there point on that one. Beer prices are too high for me there, so just had water.  The waiter was exemplerary, I would say yes I would return or maybe order the pizza to-go next time.

As with any restaurant, the service at this location can vary by the waiter you get and how busy the restaurant is that night, but overall it's good. This location is central to a friend I get together with regularly so I eat here probably 2-3 times per month or more.  Obviously their primary offering is pizza. All pizzas are personal sized, probably 9-10" if I had to guess. Their standard crust is sort of a thick pita bread/thin pizza crust. They have a thin crust option that is nearly a cracker and from what I've heard from friends, not very good. Their standard crust is also available in a honey wheat variety by request. Pizzas are cooked in a wood oven in their open kitchen.  Their most popular pizzas are BBQ Chicken and Thai Chicken but they have lots of other interesting options. Some combinations sound odd but are probably very good. They offer an "adventurer's guarantee" which means that you are invited to try something new and if you don't like it, they will replace it with your favorite at no extra charge. I typically get the garlic chicken or the BBQ chicken pizzas.  They also have very good salads available in full or half sizes. My friend gets the Thai crunch salad which he raves about every time we go.  Some of their pasta offerings are good, but I wasn't all that satisfied with the fettuccine Alfredo that came with a salmon dish I got once. The alfredo sauce was too thick and pasty.  A favorite appetizer is their Tuscan Hummus which is made with white beans and garlic and served with wonderful thick pita bread. We get it almost every time we go.  This location offers free sourdough bread and butter if you ask. It used to be a standard offering but I guess corporate stopped it, but some people expect it so they continue to offer it on request.  They offer a variety of desserts beyond the standard cheesecake/apple/brownie offerings of every other restaurant. This includes red velvet cake, Chocolate Soufflé Cake, and a chocolate banana royale cake that was well received by our group in the past.  Seasonally they have pumpkin cheesecake which in the past I remember being incredible, but they seem to have fallen into the trend I noticed in cookbooks this year where plain pumpkin cheesecake is too boring, so they have to mix it with something. In this case, it's a pumpkin cheesecake with a ginger praline crust. If you didn't eat the crust it wasn't bad, but there was a layer of something else and really the pumpkin only existed on the top layer. Other places have better pumpkin cheesecake now. Saltgrass Steakhouse and Cheesecake Factory are the two best I know of.
This place is pretty good. I love the bacon club egg rolls.

Probably won't go back here. Okay I won't. The food wasn't horrible, it tasted good. (Not great, good) The problem was: it was lukewarm. I don't know about you, but I like my food piping hot when it's brought to me.  Why? Because I know that when I'm talking or casually eating my food it's going to cool down. And that's exactly what it was cold. I guess I'm saying that it's not worth it, nothing really stands out with this place.
Fire oven pizza good stuff. I like the wheat crust pizza dough. Ask for Robert or Boone who bartend. The food is a little pricey though.

I haven't been to California Pizza Kitchen in a long time, and I missed how good it is.  The place has a nice atmosphere and our server was very nice and helpful.  We started off with the Crunchy Mac n Cheese, which was pretty tasty.  I had the Caribbean Jerk Chicken Pizza and my friend had the Meat Cravers.  Both were really good.  My only complaint would be how pricey it is compared to other gourmet pizza places, but going there on occasion is a treat.

My hubby and I went to our local CPK ( for the zillionth time ) for a pasta craving and he ended up getting the Sicilian pizza. I choose something new & tried the Moroccan Chicken Salad. The salad was amazing with all sorts of flavors. I'm full but I still want more. We split a Tiramusu to top of the great meal. Our two servers were great!

This review is pretty outdate since I haven't gone there more then once or twice in the past few years. But when it first opened, I was unfortunate enough to have friends that loved it. The service was always slow slow SLOW. People in California have never heard of this place for a reason. The food is gross! I love unique pizza (can you say spinach, mushroom, and alfredo anyone?) but this is just cheap and nasty. Avoid it at all costs.

I first tried this place in Atlanta off of Peach Tree and was so in love with the oven brick style cooking right up close and personal. The taste is sooo good and fresh. Drinks aren't that bad either. Very busy during lunch hours so make sure you have the time to savor every bit of the taste..

I love California Pizza Kitchen! They always serve a great product! Last time I went they apologized for taking so long and gave me my pizza for free... and I had only been sitting there for 15 minutes, I didn't complain and thought the pizza was out earlier than usual... i was sooo happy! Their pizza's are all amazing and just are different than anything else you will get. It's always cool to try a new pizza. I have found the perfect one! The Japanese Eggplant with Goat Cheese!!! IT'S SOOOOOO AMAZING! Get it on Honey Wheat dough!

Even though it is located in epicenter of Grapevine's chain restaurant abyss, CPK is still a good option. A few things I can comment on: 1) They'll give you a healthier alternative to the 'bleached enriched white flour' dough and make you a whole wheat crust instead. 2) They don't have anchovies. 3) They use fresh-sliced Serrano peppers when you ask for jalapenos, and Serrano's are hotter. 4) Their tiramisu is awesome.

Had a really good experience here.   They encourage you to try something new and if you dont like it they will trade it for something more standard.  I tried the Thai chicken pizza and didnt even think about trading!   Really different..and really good.  Our server was great..I will definitely go back.

Since moving from D/FW several years ago, I've come to appreciate CPK. We now frequent the actual original location in Beverly Hills as our hometown CPK and what impresses me about the chain is that no matter what locale you step into ... the service and food are always top-notch.  The Grapevine location is no exception ... the wait-staff is so friendly and the food is just as tasty as at the original location. I don't typically love chain restaurants, but I make an exception for CPK ... they use quality ingredients, have one of the best salad menus around, and their pizza options are always consistently yum-e.

P.F. Changs had an hour long wait so we went to CPK.  Service was awesome.  Very friendly which always makes a big difference to me.  I got the Jamica Jerk Chicken pizza which was spicy and very good.  The waitress brought out my wife's pizza and then came back a minute later with another one.  She said they thought the first one was a little over cooked so they made her another one.  Note:  We did not ask for this.  They did it on their own.  Very impressive.  We kept the first one because it wasn't over done much at all.  This is the kind of service that will make us come back.  I highly recommend this CPK.

Overpriced everything (but still always returning to try more menu items). The pizzas are good if you pick the right ones, just make sure to read over the item descriptions and adjust accordingly with your server. I enjoyed the soups, and mixed drinks, and the atmosphere isn't too bad.

Man this place has some yummy dishes! There is this lime-chicken-pasta thing that is exceptional. The atmosphere is so-so and the prices are a bit high for the type of place it is. It is very different and worth a stop by every now and then though!

can i give a negative rating?? Please read below to learn why.. My husband and I went along with a few of our friends to CPK at grapevine,tx couple of weeks ago. My husband ordered a pizza first.  I later decided to order a salad as well. The waiter brought out the salad  and i found a hair nicely rooted into a dried tomato in the salad!!! Completely disgusting. My god!!You would think they would take some extra care preparing a salad.. Anyway I called the waiter and showed her the hair that was nicely rooted in the tomato. I asked her for another salad as no one in their right mind would go ahead and eat that. Anyway she said the kitchen was closed and that she cannot get me another one..Well in that case you would assume that they would at least take it off the check.. Nope non-apologetically she brought the check with the salad included in it.  She just acted as though nothing happened. Seriously I have not seen any other restaurant with such a worst customer service. who does this kind of a thing? It was their mistake so they should rectify it. If they have to charge me for it they should at least have the courtesy to bring me a new salad. I pay for something which is not edible b'cos of their mistake and I have to pay for it??? ridiculous.. Such a bad experience... It's very hard to fathom that a restaruant like CPK is capable of such a bad customer experience.. I did not ask them for a favor.. I asked them to fix something they screwed up and I was willing to pay for it once they fix it.. But CPK would rather let me pay for their mistake than fix it .. Good Job CPK.. This is how you run a business.. Anyway we did not want to beg them to remove the salad off. We paid.. One last final bill at CPK..We decided we will never ever go back.  Thankfully there are plenty of restaurants in DFW metroplex who offer a very good service and have xcellent food every time u go..  So GoodBye for ever CPK..  Btw, How do I post a picture? I actually took a picture so i can post it here..

I honestly cant belive this is still around. Pizza styles are gourmet and not everyday type of meat and cheese. This place is normally semi busy which I just am not sure how this can be. Another dime a dozen pizza place that is overpriced. Id pass and go somewhere else.

I'll give this place credit for what it is, as it is a franchise that has to mass produce.  Business here is always pretty busy, as it is at a huge intersection in greater DFW.  Appetizers are pretty fun here, as they have California club eggrolls with bacon, avocado, and chicken.  Pizza is pretty clever here too, with a real California take.  Honey-wheat pizza is a nice healthier option, but texture is nothing to special on either crust here.  Just a simple palate for a variety of ingredients.  BBQ chicken sauce is a bit too sweet, but the California is a nice chicken pizza.  Another good chicken option is the jerk, which has a bit of a kick.  The Greek is also good, as the tzaziki sauce is not half bad, and the olives and feta give it an actual ethnic touch.  Wild mushroom pizza is actually pretty original, with this nice walnut pesto.  For a healthier pizza, go for the crispy, thin crusted Tricolor salad pizza, as it comes topped with a heaping mound of simply dressed greens and raddichio.  All in all, pizzas are a tad unique here, but it does lack authentic flair in each of its ethnic pizzas, though all are prepared up to pizza standards.  Definitely one for groups and families.
love their pizzas.  service isn't all that great.  i miss cpk!
